column4: Hi, #ubuntuans.  I just installed a new ubuntu system on this box, and everything seems smashing except that my computer seems confused about the size of my monitor.
Everything displayed is a bit too stretched horizontally/squeezed vertically...
I'm unsure what the processor is...
Have you tried beating it with a stick yet? (Joking) => you might want to check for the proper video driver.
So...how do I go about that?
I'm not happy nor familiar with 11.04, so you might want to look somewhere in the System Settings for "Hardware Drivers" => see if the proper video driver is installed mate.
Also, I'm not familiar with this "system settings" thing
Awesome. Right. Then click SYSTEM => ADMINISTRATION => ADDITIONAL DRIVERS
Awesome. Right.  I'm not using one of the standard guis.
and m0n : groovy...it's downloading a driver.  I'll let you know if it works...  Thanks!
Does that mean you're buying the beer?
Um...it actually should be something like /dev/sr0
